channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023110034
item.description:
Report X-2023110034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the unload leaking out and damaged the box, it was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA hut to be processed. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps which caused liquid to leak out and damaged the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat bag into a yellow drum where it was placed into hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was unloaded around 6 am and was noticed with the exterior wet. Package was placed in a hazardous bag and tote. DescribePack: Near the cap DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a hazardous tote and bag. placed standing upright to stop leak.

item.title: Report X-2023101373
item.description:
Report X-2023101373

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded on to delivery van and the cap failed spilling liquid contents. Package was removed from delivery van once returned to station. DescribePack: Loose cap caused leakage. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed right-side up in a properly lined hazmat tote. The spillage was cleaned immediately.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package was placed in a hamat bag lined tote and sent to QA area. DescribePack: Containers had loose closure along with a crack on the bottom of the bottle.
